0b.name: SIGNEXTEND
0b.description: Extend length of two's complement signed integer

30.name: ADDRESS
30.description: Get address of currently executing account

31.name: BALANCE
31.description: Get balance of the given account

34.name: CALLVALUE
34.description: Get deposited value by the instruction/transaction responsible for this execution

35.name: CALLDATALOAD
35.description: Gets the input data of the current environment. `offset` greater than 2^32-33 causes execution to panic.

36.name: CALLDATASIZE
36.description: Get size of input data in current environment

37.name: CALLDATACOPY
37.description:
Copies input data in the current environment to memory.

Executes a loop of calldataload and mstore in order to load and copy the calldata into memory. The execution will panic if `2^32-32 + offset %32 < offset + len`.

38.name: CODESIZE
38.description:
Gets the size of the code in case it is called on a Runtime code.

If called on a deploy code, the returned size is the size of the constructor arguments only (excluding deploy code size).

3a.name: GASPRICE
3a.description: Get price of gas in current environment

3b.name: EXTCODESIZE
3b.description: Get size of an account's code

3d.name: RETURNDATASIZE
3d.description: Get size of output data from the previous call from the current environment

3e.name: RETURNDATACOPY
3e.description: Copy output data from the previous call to memory

3f.name: EXTCODEHASH
3f.description: Get hash of an account's code

40.name: BLOCKHASH
40.description: Get the hash of one of the 256 most recent complete blocks

41.name: COINBASE
41.description: Returns the address of the Bootloader contract, which is `0x8001`

47.name: SELFBALANCE
47.description: Get balance of currently executing account

51.name: MLOAD
51.description:
Loads word from memory.

Memory growth is counted in bytes. Payment fees for memory growth are charged linearly at a rate of 1 erg per byte.

`zksolc` and `zkvyper` compilers may produce different msize compared to Ethereum's solc since fewer bytes have been allocated. This may lead to cases where the EVM panics, but ZKsync's EraVM does not due to the difference in memory growth

52.name: MSTORE
52.description:
Saves word to memory.

Memory growth is counted in bytes. Payment fees for memory growth are charged linearly at a rate of 1 erg per byte.

The custom compiler may produce different msize compared to Ethereum since fewer bytes have been allocated. This may lead to cases where the EVM panics, but ZKsync's EraVM does not due to the difference in memory growth

5a.name: GAS
5a.description: Get the amount of available gas, including the corresponding reduction for the cost of this instruction

5b.name: JUMPDEST
5b.description: Mark a valid destination for jumps

7f.name: PUSH32
7f.description: Place 32 byte (full word) item on stack

a0.name: LOG0
a0.description: Append log record with no topics

a1.name: LOG1
a1.description: Append log record with one topic

a2.name: LOG2
a2.description: Append log record with two topics

a3.name: LOG3
a3.description: Append log record with three topics

a4.name: LOG4
a4.description: Append log record with four topics

f0.name: CREATE
f0.description:
The `zksolc` and `zkvyper` compilers provide syntactic sugar solution to developers.

Compilers replace `CREATE` opcodes with `CALL` to a system contract `ContractDeployer` providing contract deployment functionality.

The address of the contract is calculated by `address = keccak(CREATE_PREFIX, sender, senderNonce)`

f1.name: CALL
f1.description:
Creates a new sub-context and executes the code of the given account.

The OPCODE does not support sending ether natively.

If not compiled with `zk-solc` or `zk-vyper`, Ether must be send using a system contract `MsgValueSimulator` prior to executing the CALL opcode.

`zk-solc` and `zk-vyper` compilers inject the call to the system contract under the hood during compilation.

Memory growth occurs after the call has ended, leading to a difference in the memory size (msize). As a result, ZKsync Era may not panic in situations where EVM would panic due to differences in memory growth.

f3.name: RETURN
f3.description:
Exits the current context successfully.

Constructors return the array of immutable values. If you use RETURN in an assembly block in the constructor, it returns the array of immutable values initialized so far.

f4.name: DELEGATECALL
f4.description:
Message-call into this account with an alternative account's code, but persisting the current values for sender and value.

The OPCODE does not support sending ether natively.

If not compiled with `zk-solc` or `zk-vyper`, Ether must be send using a system contract `MsgValueSimulator` prior to executing the CALL opcode.

`zk-solc` and `zk-vyper` compilers inject the call to the system contract under the hood during compilation.

Memory growth occurs after the call has ended, leading to a difference in the memory size (msize). As a result, ZKsync Era may not panic in situations where EVM would panic due to differences in memory growth.

f5.name: CREATE2
f5.description:
The `zksolc` and `zkvyper` compilers provide syntactic sugar solution to developers.

Compilers replace CREATE2 opcodes with CALL to a system contract `ContractDeployer` providing contract deployment functionality.

The address of the newly deployed contract is calculated by `address = keccak256(CREATE2_PREFIX, sender, salt, bytecodeHash, constructorInputHash)`

fa.name: STATICCALL
fa.description:
Executes a static message call into an account.

Memory growth occurs after the call has ended, leading to a difference in the memory size (msize). As a result, ZKsync Era may not panic in situations where EVM would panic due to differences in memory growth

fd.name: REVERT
fd.description: Halt execution reverting state changes but returning data and remaining gas

0x01.name: ecRecover
0x01.description: Elliptic curve digital signature algorithm (ECDSA) public key recovery function

0x06.name: ecAdd
0x06.description: Point addition (ADD) on the elliptic curve `alt_bn128`

0x07.name: ecMul
0x07.description: Scalar multiplication (MUL) on the elliptic curve `alt_bn128`

0x08.name: ecPairing
0x08.description: Bilinear function on groups on the elliptic curve `alt_bn128`

0x100.name: p256Verify
0x100.description: Performs signature verifications in the secp256r1 elliptic curve

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: AccountCodeStorage
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Stores a mapping of modified versions of code hashes and account addresses. It is used by the custom compilers in order to simulate extcodehash and extcodesize opcodes

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: NonceHolder
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Along with `bootloader` this contract ensures that the pair (sender, nonce) is always unique, thus ensuring the uniqueness of transaction hashes. Can be used to provide nonce-related information for an account

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: KnownCodesStorage
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Maintains a mapping of known code hashes and additional metadata. It is mostly consumed by other system contracts but can provide bytecode-related information for a given address

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: ImmutableSimulator
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Serves as a utility contract for the custom compiler. It stores immutable variables created during deployment by other contracts. It is needed so that contracts with the same solidity code but different constructors parameters have the same bytecode

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: ContractDeployer
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Provides functions for deploying smart contracts on the network as well as retrieving account-related information. It is utilised by the custom compilers in order to simulate `create` and `create2` opcodes

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: L1Messenger
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Provides functionality for sending arbitrary-length messages to L1

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: L2BaseToken
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Used by the `bootloader`, `MsgValueSimulator` and `ContractDeployer` system contracts to perform balance changes while simulating the msg.value behaviour on Ethereum

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: SystemContext
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Provides context variables such as `chainId`, `tx.origin`, `gasPrice`, `blockGasLimit` etc. It is utilised by the custom compiler to provide the implementation of block-related opcodes

0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.name: BootloaderUtilities
0x00000000000000000000000000000000000080.description: Provides utility functions for computing transaction hashes for a given transaction data depending on its transaction type. It is utilised by the Bootloader contract
